newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian gold mine says may work with Canada's Rux.
newsitem.headline: Russian gold mine says may work with Canada's Rux.

text.p: A Russian gold mine said on Tuesday it may work with Rux Resources Inc, a unit of Canada's William Resources Inc, to tap reserves in the Urals.

Vladimir Albrecht, vice-president of Gold of Northern Urals, or GNU, said Rux could be prepared to invest $120 million to construct a mining and enriching plant to tap 98 tonnes of gold at the Vorontsovsk field 400 km north of Yekatarinburg in the Sverdlovsk region.
Rux could not be reached for immediate comment.
Albrecht said Rux could acquire 49 percent of GNU, whose shareholders are various Russian joint stock companies.
Very few planned foreign mining ventures in Russia, which has the world's third largest gold reserves, have yet to get off the ground due to legislative red tape and investment risk.
